result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Arnez Miller

records.addlTxt: Final pre-trial on December 19, 2022 at 02:20 pm.
Calendar call on October 13, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Clerk: Amanda. 
Cases called at 2:39 pm. 
INCLUDES: 22CF897 and 22CM590. 

State appears by ADA Lacey Coonen and Cody Marshcall.  Defendant is not present, but Attorney John Wallace appears on defendant's behalf via zoom telephone. 
VRCW.

Court notes defendant was moved to a different facility. 
Parties may have an agreement and wish to set a CC. 

JT to be removed from the calendar. 
NEXT DATE: 10/13 at 1:00 pm to set TPD/FPT. 

Adj: 2:40 pm.
Final pre-trial on October 5, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Case Called: 2:14 pm
INCLUDES 22CF897 & 22CM590.
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Cody Marschall in person. Defendant does not appear. Atty John Wallace appears via Zoom Video on behalf of the Defendant.
VRCW.
Atty Wallace makes statements. 
Parties are to schedule a Plea Hearing. 
DATES:
Calendar Call 09/15/2022 @ 1:00 pm
Adjourned: 2:16 pm

Pre-trial conference on August 9, 2022 at 11:20 am.
Final pre-trial on September 9, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Jury Trial on October 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.

No contact with victim(s): D.L.F. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Police escort to retrieve personal property from the residence. Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release.  Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 1 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

Clerk: Amanda.
Case called at 2:14 pm.
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo. Defendant appears from MCJ, and with Attorney Fontana and Cannon.
Date and Time set for IA; VRCW. 

Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
Court questions deft re: complaint and rights.
Advised Right of Counsel. 

PLEA: NOT GUILTY. 

COURT ORDERS: $500 signature bond - CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with victim(s): D.L.F. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
- Police escort to retrieve personal property from the residence. 
- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release.  Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 1 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.
